entry.def: If you load a vehicle or a container, you put a large quantity of things into it.

example.ex: The three men seemed to have finished loading the truck...
example.tran: 这3名男子似乎已把东西往卡车上装载完毕。

example.ex: Mr. Dambar had loaded his plate with lasagne...
example.tran: 丹巴尔先生盛了一大盘千层面。

entry.def: A load is something, usually a large quantity or heavy object, which is being carried.

example.ex: He drove by with a big load of hay...
example.tran: 他载着一大车干草驶过。

example.ex: He was carrying a very heavy load.
example.tran: 他身上背着沉甸甸的东西。

entry.def: A load is a quantity of clothes or sheets which need washing and which are washed together in a washing machine.

example.ex: I put another load in the washing machine.
example.tran: 我把另一堆衣服放进洗衣机。

entry.def: If you refer to a load of people or things or loads of them, you are emphasizing that there are a lot of them.

example.ex: His people came up with a load of embarrassing information...
example.tran: 他的部下亮出一大堆令人尴尬的资料来。

entry.def: When someone loads a weapon such as a gun, they put a bullet or missile in it so that it is ready to use.

example.ex: I knew how to load and handle a gun...
example.tran: 我知道怎么上子弹，也知道枪怎么用。
他带了一把子弹上膛的枪。

entry.tran: 把（胶卷、磁带等）装入；将（数据）载入
entry.def: To load a camera or other piece of equipment means to put film, tape, or data into it so that it is ready to use.

example.ex: A photographer from the newspaper was loading his camera with film...
example.tran: 那家报纸的一名摄影师正往相机里装胶卷。

example.ex: A technician loads a video tape into one of the machines...
example.tran: 一名技师把一盒录影带装进其中一台机器。

entry.def: You can refer to the amount of work you have to do as a load .

example.ex: She's taking some of the load off the secretaries.
example.tran: 她在给秘书们减轻一些工作量。

entry.def: The load of a system or piece of equipment, especially a system supplying electricity or a computer, is the extent to which it is being used at a particular time.

example.ex: An efficient bulb may lighten the load of power stations...
example.tran: 一个节能灯泡也许就能减轻发电站的负荷。

example.ex: Several processors can share the load of handling data in a single program.
example.tran: 几个处理器可共同分担处理一个程序数据的负荷。

entry.def: The load on something is the amount of weight that is pressing down on it or the amount of strain that it is under.

example.ex: Some of these chairs have flattened feet which spread the load on the ground...
example.tran: 这些椅子中有的是平脚的，这样可分散地面所受的压力。

example.ex: High blood pressure imposes an extra load on the heart.
example.tran: 高血压会给心脏增加额外的负担。

means.word_mean: 1. weight to be borne or conveyed
2. a quantity that can be processed or transported at one time;

sentences.sentence: "the system broke down under excessive loads"

means.word_mean: 3. the ratio of the gross weight of an airplane to some factor determining its lift
4. goods carried by a large vehicle

Sentence.sentence: More than paradise lost, a perishing rain forest could trigger a domino effect - sending winds and rains kilometers off course and loading the skies with even greater levels of greenhouse gases - that will be felt far beyond the Amazon basin.

sentences.en: Freight-car loadings continue to slack off.
sentences.cn: 火车货运的运输量继续减少。
